text: what we experience is like something you
see in a horror movie persons were
literally running from house to house
and we had cars flying over our heads we
had containers 40-foot containers flying
left and right and the story is that the
story that you're getting from most of
the residents here is that the eye of
the storm came just in time persons were
literally tying themselves to them their
rooms with ropes to keep them down last
night was a horrible experience to me my
mom cried and my brother wake me up I I
was frightened I didn't know this wasn't
gonna happen to me when the wind really
real intense we had to rescue a
three-year-old child and that was one of
experience that was really really
telling on us we tell ourselves that
look there's a child we must glow and
while we're doing that the roof or the
fire station came up put the men in more
fear but they'll let me know that we
have a job to do and we do it with all
our might knowing that this our duty to
serve this nation of Antigua and Barbuda
and we did it
